wikipedia_page.main: Jacob Augustus Lockhart Clarke (1817 – 25 January 1880) was a British physiologist and neurologist who is primarily known for his studies of the brain and the spinal cord.

response: Clarke's column is named for Jacob Augustus Lockhart Clarke.J. A. L. Clarke. Researches into the structure of the spinal cord. Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society of London, 1851, 141: 607-621.

link_mentions.page: List of fellows of the Royal Society A, B, C

response: * Jacob Augustus Lockhart Clarke, British neurologist
